page.title: 04ECOLOGY (2)
page.content: The climate of the area is a type of 'continental climate'. Rainfall which is about 550 - 650mm (22 - 24 inches) is evenly distributed throughout the year. Summer temperatures reach 18'C with some long warm, dry spells being commonplace. Winter temperatures average out at 4'C with many days of frost but only a few days of standing snow. Winds are sometimes a problem over this flat landscape especially in March and April when the ground has dried out and the new crops have not grown very much. In extreme cases severe erosion can occur with much hardship and loss of money for the farmers.
